New Records: Harry Kane reached 100 caps for England
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored twice, including his 68th goal for England
Trent Alexander-Arnold made two killer passes, including one for Kane's second goal
Finland's Topi Keskinen had two assists tonight, but his team failed to capitalize
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley emphasized the importance of being ruthless and knocking on the door
Harry Kane expressed his excitement for the future and his desire to prove doubters wrong
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley praised his team's performance and Harry Kane's goalscoring
Harry Kane reflected on his 100th cap and his goalscoring record for England
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wembley, with a half-empty crowd by the end
Finland's Teemu Pukki had a couple of chances, but was unable to capitalize
Others: The result leaves England top of Group B2, with Greece and Finland level on points
The match was broadcast on ITV, with Harry Kane and Lee Carsley speaking to the media after the game
